isis.stitle: International® T 444E Diesel Engine - Model Years Late 1997 to 2003 - Engine Electrical - Main Engine Wiring Harness - Installation

note.para: For installation of the IPR valve, refer to the HIGH PRESSURE OIL PUMP section.

step1.para: If removed, install the EOT, ECT, EBP, EOP, and MAP sensors in their proper locations .
If removed, install the CMP sensor as follows:

step2.para: If necessary, check the clearance of the CMP sensor. Refer to Verify CMP Sensor Clearance (Air Gap) in this section.
Put a new O-ring on the sensor and lubricate the O-ring with clean engine oil.
Insert the sensor into the port. Secure the sensor with the mounting bolt.

step1.para: If removed, install the ICP sensor as follows:

step2.para: Put a new O-ring on the sensor.
Apply Loctite® #277 to the threads of the sensor. Install the sensor in the front left cylinder head bank and tighten the sensor to the special torque value.

figure.caption: 9-Pin Connector to the Valve Cover Gasket

note.para: To ensure the electrical connection between the wiring harness and the valve cover gasket, install a new retainer clip from service kit P/N 1844193C91 on both wiring harness connectors.

step1.para: Connect the two 9-pin connectors to the valve cover gaskets. There is one for each valve cover.

note.para: Make sure that each connector has its ribbed seal in place before installation into sensor. In some cases, a ribbed seal may pull off its connector during removal and remain in the mating socket of a sensor or actuator. A connector that is installed without the appropriate ribbed seal may become contaminated with moisture and corrode the terminals, resulting in a poor electrical connection.

step1.para: Install the wiring harness on the engine. Carefully align the connectors with the sensors. Push each connector into its mating socket until the locking tabs are fully latched.
Install the wiring harness routing clips.
